segments.text: I see the boy reaching for the cookie jar, and I feel a pang of disgust.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it’s about to tip over any second, and it’s making me sick to my stomach.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her cookie, completely unaware of the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe the woman hasn’t turned around yet—it’s so irresponsible.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is pouring over the sink, and she’s just drying dishes like nothing’s wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the floor must be so slippery by now, and it’s just gross.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is going to fall, and the woman is going to slip—it’s a mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the kids even realize how dangerous this is, but I doubt it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene feels like a disaster waiting to happen, and it’s making me feel ill.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t look away, even though I know it’s going to end badly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so calm, but inside, it’s pure chaos and it’s disgusting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is going to regret not paying attention when it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
